content.raw:
Looking closer, the ash job was already invalidating at that step because of the monthly invalidation.

Now that I am actually reading the generated dockerfile, I've noticed that even though the `BASE_DEPENDENCIES` variable includes `locales` on the default branch, the branch I'm using must be out of date enough that it doesn't. So r2d2 must have been working because the cache *wasn't* invalidated, and it was riding on the coat tails of someone else's `BASE_DEPENDENCIES` that included `locales`. So this seems to be an issue that will only occur on my branch, and syncing my branch should fix this! Will report back with confirmation.
content.html:
Looking closer, the ash job was already invalidating at that step because of the monthly invalidation.

Now that I am actually reading the generated dockerfile, I've noticed that even though the BASE_DEPENDENCIES variable includes locales on the default branch, the branch I'm using must be out of date enough that it doesn't. So r2d2 must have been working because the cache wasn't invalidated, and it was riding on the coat tails of someone else's BASE_DEPENDENCIES that included locales. So this seems to be an issue that will only occur on my branch, and syncing my branch should fix this! Will report back with confirmation.
